pieces

Class ChessPiece

  • java.lang.Object
    • pieces.ChessPiece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook

    public class ChessPiece
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the class that every piece inherits from
    Author:
    Alexander Ngo 60%, -Isaac Fu- 34.5%, Areg Nersisyan 5%, David Sun 0.5%

      boolean checkpinnedPiece()
      this function checks whether or not a piece is pinned, called in getmovelocations and after the original getmovelocation is created the piece moving will make itself invisible and calls on the king's check function, if it is check then the piece is considered pinned Precondition: getmovelocations has been called Postcondition
      void checkResolution()
      Precondition an enemy piece has moved and is now capable of attacking the king, gameState has changed in checkResolution Postcondition all possible moves to resolve the check as been run and pieces have been updated accordingly unless checkmate has occurred This function examines how many pieces are attacking the king and based off of that creates a list of viable moves to resolve the check Two different checkResolutions 1) More than one piece is checking the king -> Run the king's getmovelocation 2) Only one piece is checking the king -> Run the king's getmovelocations ->Iterate through all the allies and check whether or not they can move to save the king (calls a helper function to do so)
      void checkResolutionAlliedPieces(ChessPiece originalAttacker, ChessPiece Ally)
      Preconditions: The game is in checkResolution, only one piece is checking the king, Postconditions: all pieces have been evaluated and their locations array has been updated accordingly

      visual representation of where a piece can move, differentiates attacking and movement Preconditions: A piece has been selected and getMoveLocations has been called Postconditions: the piece has been highlighted with a golden square, and it's viable move locations with a green square
      void move(int row, int column)
      Function that actually moves the pieces, children all call this first in their own respective move functions Preconditions : getMoveLocations or a modified version of it (for checking and pinning )has already been run, Postconditions: the piece has been moved to the indicated position, the GameBoard + player piece arrays have been updated accordingly
      void pinnedPieceMovementHelper()
      This function is called when a piece is pinned, it looks at the locations array of the piece and will modify it accordingly based on what is attacking the king should it move, e.g.
      void promotionImmunity()
      Function that is called to check if there is a pawn currently promoting This function will make that pawn invincible during their promotion by removing that pawn from a valid move location Precondition : a piece wants to move and has called getMoveLocations Postcondition : the square holding a pawn promoting has been removed if that pawn existed else nothing happens
      void recursion(int row, int col, int rowIncre, int colIncre)
      getMoveLocation implementation for Rook, Bishop, Queen Takes in

      • ChessPiece

        public ChessPiece(int row,
                  int column,
                  boolean color)
        Generic constructor to initialize piece on top on the Graphics and GameBoard
        Parameters:
        row, - row that the piece will be created in
        column, - column that the piece will be created in
        color, - Black (false) or White(true) the team the piece is associated with

        Returns:
        boolean, whether the piece has moved or not

        Parameters:

        public void CastleMove(int row,
                       int column)
        Only invoked when the king initiates a Castle, special move function
        Parameters:
        row - row to move the king to
        col - column to move the king to

      • move

        public void move(int row,
                 int column)
        Function that actually moves the pieces, children all call this first in their own respective move functions Preconditions : getMoveLocations or a modified version of it (for checking and pinning )has already been run, Postconditions: the piece has been moved to the indicated position, the GameBoard + player piece arrays have been updated accordingly
        Parameters:
        row - row to move the piece
        col - column to move the piece

      • promotionImmunity

        public void promotionImmunity()
        Function that is called to check if there is a pawn currently promoting This function will make that pawn invincible during their promotion by removing that pawn from a valid move location Precondition : a piece wants to move and has called getMoveLocations Postcondition : the square holding a pawn promoting has been removed if that pawn existed else nothing happens

      • draw

        public boolean draw()
        This function checks if the game has ended in a draw Some valid draw scenarios 1) King vs King 2) King + Bishop 3) King + Knight 4) King + Bishop vs King + Bishop and both bishops are the same color
        Returns:
        true if the game is a draw, false if the game is still playable Preconditions : a piece has just moved Postconditions : returns true if draw , false if the game is not in draw

      • die

        public void die()
        Called when a piece is successfully attacked

      • getMoveLocations

        public void getMoveLocations()
        Creates a list of all possible movement locations for that current piece Each piece has it's own implementation of this. but calls on this parent function before it does its own This parent version does a couple of things 1) clears the existing locations arraylist created previously 2) sets the piece's visiblity to false (useful for checking if the piece is pinned) 3) if the gamestate is in checkresolution, a new locations arraylist will NOT be created this effectively prevents enemy pieces + allied pieces that cannot resolve the check from moving

      • checkhighlightLocation

        public void checkhighlightLocation()
        The king overrides this

      • clearcheckhighlightLocation

        public void clearcheckhighlightLocation()
        The king overrides this

      • highlightLocation

        public void highlightLocation()
        visual representation of where a piece can move, differentiates attacking and movement Preconditions: A piece has been selected and getMoveLocations has been called Postconditions: the piece has been highlighted with a golden square, and it's viable move locations with a green square

      • unhighlightLocation

        public void unhighlightLocation(int row,
                                int column)
        Unhighlights the board based the piece on the specified row column by going through the locations array and setting the image to null
        Parameters:
        row, - row of the piece
        column, - column of the piece Preconditions: A piece has been unselected, killed, or moved Postconditions: it's old highlight locations are removed from the board

      • getColor

        public boolean getColor()
        Returns:
        the piece's associated color

      • returnLocations

        public java.util.ArrayList<Square> returnLocations()
        Precondition: getmoveLocations or a variant must be run before this Postcondition @return arraylist of where a piece can move

      • recursion

        public void recursion(int row,
                      int col,
                      int rowIncre,
                      int colIncre)
        getMoveLocation implementation for Rook, Bishop, Queen Takes in
        Parameters:
        row, - current row value of piece
        col, - current column value of piece
        rowIncre, - how much to increment the row by, e.g. if moving up one, -1
        colIncre, - how much to increment the col by Begins to check each spot in the direction indicated by rowIncre and colIncre stops when it hits an enemy piece, an allied piece, or hits the border of the chessboard

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        draw method draws the image associated with the piece

      • checkResolution

        public void checkResolution()
        Precondition an enemy piece has moved and is now capable of attacking the king, gameState has changed in checkResolution Postcondition all possible moves to resolve the check as been run and pieces have been updated accordingly unless checkmate has occurred This function examines how many pieces are attacking the king and based off of that creates a list of viable moves to resolve the check Two different checkResolutions 1) More than one piece is checking the king -> Run the king's getmovelocation 2) Only one piece is checking the king -> Run the king's getmovelocations ->Iterate through all the allies and check whether or not they can move to save the king (calls a helper function to do so)

      • checkResolutionAlliedPieces

        public void checkResolutionAlliedPieces(ChessPiece originalAttacker,
                                        ChessPiece Ally)
        Preconditions: The game is in checkResolution, only one piece is checking the king, Postconditions: all pieces have been evaluated and their locations array has been updated accordingly
        Parameters:
        originalAttacker - the original piece attacking the king
        Ally - the ally that locations is being creates for (cannot be a king (the kings getmovelocations function will handle this)) What this function does is it determines what is attacking the king and what direction that piece is attacking for e.g. if it's a pawn/knight then you cannot bodyblock, you must kill the piece outright

      • checkmate

        public boolean checkmate(int condition)
        Parameters:
        condition, - 0 = more than one piece is checking the king , 1 = only one piece is checking the king
        Returns:
        true if checkmate, false if a piece can resolve Checking for checkmate 1) if the king is being checked by more than one enemy piece, an allied piece cannot save the king if the king cannot move as well, then checkmate has occurred 2) if the king is only being checked by one enemy piece, then an allied piece may bodyblock for the king or the king can move if neither of these options are valid, checkmate has occurred

      • checkKing

        public void checkKing(boolean color)
        Checks if the king is in check, called after every move function finishes, if the king is checked sets isChecked to true
        Parameters:
        color, - true for white king, false for black king

      • checkpinnedPiece

        public boolean checkpinnedPiece()
        this function checks whether or not a piece is pinned, called in getmovelocations and after the original getmovelocation is created the piece moving will make itself invisible and calls on the king's check function, if it is check then the piece is considered pinned Precondition: getmovelocations has been called Postcondition
        Returns:
        returns true if a piece is pinned (moving will cause allied king to go into check)

      • pinnedPieceMovementHelper

        public void pinnedPieceMovementHelper()
        This function is called when a piece is pinned, it looks at the locations array of the piece and will modify it accordingly based on what is attacking the king should it move, e.g. if a rook is attacking vertically then a pinned piece can move along the same row the enemy rook is Precondition : checkpinnedPiece has been called and has returned true, getMovelocations has been called and a locations array has been created Postcondition: locations array has been modified to include only moves that would not check the king

      • checkSquare

        public boolean checkSquare(int row,
                           int column)
        This function checks whether or not a square is under attack by an enemy piece, it does this by checked every direction a piece can attack from
        Parameters:
        row, - row to check
        column, - column to check
        Returns:
        boolean that indicates whether or not that space is being attacked or not

      • checkPieceVertical

        public void checkPieceVertical(int row,
                               int col,
                               int rowIncre,
                               int oriRow,
                               int piecesFound,
                               int spacesMoved,
                               java.util.ArrayList<ChessPiece> otherPieces)
        This is a helper function that is called in checkSquare, recursively finds enemy pieces in the vertical direction PreCondition: checkSquare is called Postcondition: any enemy pieces found have been added to arraylist OtherPieces
        Parameters:
        row, - row of square to check
        col, - col of square to check
        rowIncre, - how much to increment the row by
        oriRow, - the original row
        piecesFound, - how many pieces that have been found
        spacesMoved, - applicable if the original square was the king
        otherPieces, - arraylist that stores attacking pieces

      • checkPieceHorizontal

        public void checkPieceHorizontal(int row,
                                 int col,
                                 int colIncre,
                                 int oriCol,
                                 int piecesFound,
                                 int spacesMoved,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<ChessPiece> otherPieces)
        This is a helper function that is called in checkSquare, recursively finds enemy pieces in the horizontal direction PreCondition: checkSquare is called Postcondition: any enemy pieces found have been added to arraylist OtherPieces
        Parameters:
        row, - row of square to check
        col, - col of square to check
        colIncre, - how much to increment the col by
        oriRow, - the original row
        piecesFound, - how many pieces that have been found
        spacesMoved, - applicable if the original square was the king
        otherPieces, - arraylist that stores attacking pieces

      • checkPieceDiagonals

        public void checkPieceDiagonals(int row,
                                int col,
                                int rowIncre,
                                int colIncre,
                                int oriRow,
                                int oriCol,
                                int piecesFound,
                                int spacesMoved,
                                java.util.ArrayList<ChessPiece> otherPieces,
                                ChessPiece found)
        This is a helper function that is called in checkSquare, recursively finds enemy pieces in the diagonal direction PreCondition: checkSquare is called Postcondition: any enemy pieces found have been added to arraylist OtherPieces
        Parameters:
        row - of square that is being checked
        col - of square that is being checked
        rowIncre - how much to increment the row for
        colIncre - how much to increment the col for
        oriRow - the original row that the recursive function started on
        oriCol - the original col that that recursive function started on
        piecesFound - how many pieces the function has found
        spacesMoved - important when the original row and column start on the king
        otherPieces - arraylist that enemy pieces are added to

      • checkHorseHelper

        public java.util.ArrayList<ChessPiece> checkHorseHelper(int row,
                                                        int column)
        This is a helper function that is called in checkSquare, finds enemy horses PreCondition: checkSquare is called Postcondition: any enemy horses found have been added to arraylist OtherPieces
        Parameters:
        row - to check
        column - to check
        Returns:
        arraylist full of enemy horses
